pullRequest.title: NF: bigQuery - optimize memory usage to avoid OOM in tests
pullRequest.bodyText: I can't test on my computer because it's a travis specific problem that .29 fails regularly. So I'll need to see how travis act if i change the way to create the big string

beforeCommit.message:
NF: Avoid buffer

It seems travis with API 29

> com.ichi2.anki.tests.libanki.ModelTest > bigQuery[test(AVD) - 10] FAILED
> 	java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Failed to allocate a 9437192 byte allocation with 6291456 free bytes and 7691KB until OOM, target footprint 15192624, growth limit 16777216
> 	at java.util.Arrays.copyOf(Arrays.java:3257)
> > Task :AnkiDroid:connectedDebugAndroidTest FAILED
> FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.

This is caused by Buffer->array

I try to remove buffer, that would be counter intuitive, but it's worth a try. The hypothesis here is simply that I
would need only 20 intermediate structure instead of an aray of 400 000 elements.

afterCommit.message:
NF: Uses String builder instead of buffer

Indicates szie at construction. Trying to remove Travis flakyness

nodes.bodyText:
I don't get this. Shouldn't it be 400_000 * 12 (4_800_000)?
I think this would be more clear if you extracted both str and numberOfIterations variable, and used these in the calculation to obtain the final string length.
Agreed, str.length can be used as the multipler for the numberOfIterations variable
